subject: Testing An Inherited Class
msgSnippet: I have created a class that literally inherits other classes. This new class is specifically written to read my new XML nodes that I have introduced in the new
messageBody:
I have created a class that literally inherits other classes. This new
class is specifically written to read my new XML nodes that I have
introduced in the new file. This is done to avoid creating potential
complications or shall I say dependency problems from adding material
to an existing class.

The class reads this setting from this file called config.xml

<section-manage>
<display section_id="accession" order="asc" sort_column="1" />
<display section_id="serials" order="asc" sort_column="2" />
</section-manage>

So my new class literally reads as follows:

Class name is: SectionManageHandler
The following is the main method of how it reads the XML node.

protected void readFullDisplayLinkabilityConfig(Element elmDisplay) {
lDisplayTags = new Vector();
Element[] aelmFull =
DOMUtils.getChildElementsByTagName(elmDisplay, "full-display");
if (aelmFull != null) {
Element[] aelmSectionView =
DOMUtils.getChildElementsByTagName(aelmFull[0],
"section-manage");
Element[] aelmSectionDisplay =
DOMUtils.getChildElementsByTagName(aelmSectionView[0],
"display");
for (int i=0; i <
ArrayLengthCounter.countLength(aelmSectionDisplay); i++) {
String szSectionId =
aelmSectionDisplay[i].getAttribute("section_id");
if (szSectionId.equalsIgnoreCase("acquisition")) {
szSectionId = "acquisition";
} else if (szSectionId.equalsIgnoreCase("serials")) {
szSectionId = "serials";
} else if (szSectionId.equalsIgnoreCase("accession")) {
szSectionId = "accession";
}
lDisplayTags.add(szSectionId);
String szSortOrder =
aelmSectionDisplay[i].getAttribute("order");
if (szSortOrder != null) {
if (szSortOrder.equalsIgnoreCase("asc")){
szSortOrder = "ASC";
} else if (szSortOrder.equalsIgnoreCase("desc")) {
szSortOrder = "DESC";
}
} else {
szSortOrder = "ASC";
}
lDisplayTags.add("szSortOrder");
int iSortColumn =
Integer.parseInt(aelmSectionDisplay[i].getAttribute("sort_column"));
if(iSortColumn < 1) {
iSortColumn = 1;
} else if (iSortColumn > 10) {
iSortColumn = 1;
}
lDisplayTags.add(iSortColumn);
}
}
}

I want to make sure that the class work so it means that I have to
write a Test class file. I tried writing various ways but without
success. My test conditions are:

1. Only proceeds to read the node if section_id is not null.
2. If value of order is incorrect or blank, default value "asc" will
be used in place.
3. If value of sort_column is blank or it is either less than 1 or
more than 10, the value 1 will be used.

Pls advise or suggest workaround solutions to this -seriously I need
help. Thanks.
